Description: Rim and neck sherd of probably East Greek pottery amphora with everted ledge rim; white slip; interior reserved except for very worn band below rim and second one near centre of sherd; frieze of billets on top of rim, continuing on to edge and underside; reserved at junction of rim and neck; neck glazed with horizontal incised zigzag.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Classical Archaeology, Cambridge. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GO.021)
